intro: Asemeia monninoides, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces long, twisting vines that can climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Asemeia monninoides is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
